definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The issue of the conflict isn't as black and white from the lens of the priest in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 廟方祭師認爲，衝突不能用非黑即白兩分法論斷。

sentences.english: Population, and lasting historical legacies have all contributed to these dichotomies .
sentences.chinese: 人口和持久的歷史遺產，都促成了這種兩分法。
